channel.title: attack.t1218.010 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1218.010 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern
item.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by regsvr32 when used to download and register a DLL from a remote address which uses HTTP (not HTTPS) and a IP address and not FQDN

item.title: Suspicious Regsvr32 Execution With Image Extension
item.description: utilizes REGSVR32.exe to execute this DLL masquerading as a Image file

item.title: Created Files by Office Applications
item.description: This rule will monitor executable and script file creation by office applications. Please add more file extensions or magic bytes to the logic of your choice.

item.title: EDR WMI Command Execution by Office Applications
item.description: Initial execution of malicious document calls wmic Win32_Process::Create to execute the file with regsvr32

item.title: Lolbins Process Creation with WmiPrvse
item.description: This rule will monitor LOLBin process creations by wmiprvse. Add more LOLBins to rule logic if needed.

item.title: New Lolbin Process by Office Applications
item.description: This rule will monitor any office apps that spins up a new LOLBin process. This activity is pretty suspicious and should be investigated.

item.title: Regsvr32 Flags Anomaly
item.description: Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time

item.title: Regsvr32 Network Activity
item.description: Detects network connections and DNS queries initiated by Regsvr32.exe

item.title: Regsvr32 Anomaly
item.description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)
